title: Final Fantasy XV Director's New Studio - Kinda Funny Games Daily 03.27.18
description:
Thanks to MeUndies for sponsoring this episode.To get your 20% off your first pair, free shipping, a 100% Satisfaction Guarantee, go to: http://meundies.com/gamesdaily

Tabata's got a new role, and Greg and Tim have thoughts about it!

00:03:05 - Housekeeping
The Roper Report   -
00:04:30 - EA PLAY 2018 Tix Available, via EA
00:12:00 - Tabata Gets a New Studio, via Kotaku
00:17:50 - Fortnite Sets YouTube Record, via Ryan Wyatt
00:20:20 - Some Folks Can’t Play Sea of Thieves, via SoT Twitter
00:21:20 - Will Wright Saved DoubleFine, via Kotaku’s Splitscreen Podcast
00:25:20 - The official list of upcoming games
 Reader mail   -
00:29:40 - Baytuh - What's Next For The Metal Gear Franchise?
00:36:30 - Austin - reactions and thoughts on Detective Pikachu
00:37:15 - Mixedguy121 - Why Is Playstation Giving Away So Much Codes?
00:38:45 - Mattcat710 - Thoughts On Day One Season Pass Purchases? 
00:44:30 - NibrocBottom - What is the best way to jump into an online / "games as a service" game?
00:48:00 - Tearlessfungus - Wii or GameCube!?!?
00:50:00 - Squad Up - Xbox PUBG - PlayerOneKnown  
00:53:00- You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s host: WHITTA WEDNESDAY


Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

good look at some good guys in videogames like we talked about bad people on the show a lot they [ __ ] up this is happening what's going on this is a story that is being expanded upon from the Game Awards at GDC remember if you wash it when Tim got his Tim Schafer got his Lifetime Achievement Award and went up there he talked he mentioned how we'll right he thanked him because it kind of helped Double Fine's stay afloat over on Kotaku split-screen podcast with Jason Shriver end the show Jason asked him more about this about like how will write save Double Fine or whatever in Tim tells this story that basically during Psychonauts development about halfway through got cants it got canceled and sold like that it was just done they were making this game but nobody's paying for it anymore and so Tim had like 30 double fine employees that he was worrying about and ran around trying to talk every publisher try to get somebody to pick this up somebody to take care of it and nobody was biting

so Tim had like 30 double fine employees that he was worrying about and ran around trying to talk every publisher try to get somebody to pick this up somebody to take care of it and nobody was biting on it and we're you know obviously you're hemorrhaging money at that point if you're not bringing something in for this project and so it got down to like he just needed to pay the people and he was trying to figure out how to do this and went through every option he could and hit up will Wright who worked at Maxis at the time and was like hey I hate doing this I don't want to do this but if you'll give us this loan basically you can have 10% at double fine or maybe just pay straight up for it maybe I'm gonna tell you about their contacts but basically you'll get 10% a double fine and we'll was like hmm that's an interesting idea let me talk to the lawyers cuz I need to get involved and I'll call you back tomorrow and Tim and Jason talked about like man that's a long 24 hours to wait or
